New Records: Nikola Jokic recorded his league-leading 15th triple-double of the season and the 145th of his career.
Russell Westbrook holds the NBA record with 202 triple-doubles, with three of them coming this season.
Key Match Events: Jokic scored Denver’s first five points of the second half, fed Braun and Porter for 3-pointers, then assisted on Porter’s layup and Westbrook’s trey to make it 82-64.
Westbrook made four free throws, Braun sank two from the line and Braun hit a running dunk in a 16-5 run that made it 117-100.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets led by six at halftime and built on that throughout the third quarter.
Jamal Murray didn’t play in the second half due to left knee soreness.
The Nets had lost four in a row and seven of eight before the game.
Others: Keon Johnson scored 22 points, Tyrese Martin had 19, Noah Clowney scored 14 and Tosan Evbuomwan, Ben Simmons, Nic Claxton and Ziaire Williams had 10 each for the Nets.
